28#include <sys/cdefs.h>
29__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: i915_gem_dmabuf.c,v 1.3 2018/08/27 15:22:54 riastradh Exp $");
30
31#include <drm/drmP.h>
32#include "i915_drv.h"
33#include <linux/dma-buf.h>
34
35static struct drm_i915_gem_object *dma_buf_to_obj(struct dma_buf *buf)
36{
37 struct drm_gem_object *obj = buf->priv;
38
39 return to_intel_bo(obj);
40}
41
42static struct sg_table *i915_gem_map_dma_buf(struct dma_buf_attachment *attachment,
43 enum dma_data_direction dir)
44{
45 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj = dma_buf_to_obj(attachment->dmabuf);
46 struct sg_table *st;
47#ifdef __NetBSD__
48 int ret;
49#else
50 struct scatterlist *src, *dst;
51 int ret, i;
52#endif
53
54 ret = i915_mutex_lock_interruptible(obj->base.dev);
55 if (ret)
56 goto err;
57
58 ret = i915_gem_object_get_pages(obj);
59 if (ret)
60 goto err_unlock;
61
62 i915_gem_object_pin_pages(obj);
63
64#ifdef __NetBSD__
65 st = drm_prime_pglist_to_sg(&obj->pageq, obj->base.size >> PAGE_SHIFT);
66 if (IS_ERR(st))
67 goto err_unpin;
68#else
69 /* Copy sg so that we make an independent mapping */
70 st = kmalloc(sizeof(struct sg_table), GFP_KERNEL);
71 if (st == NULL) {
72 ret = -ENOMEM;
73 goto err_unpin;
74 }
75
76 ret = sg_alloc_table(st, obj->pages->nents, GFP_KERNEL);
77 if (ret)
78 goto err_free;
79
80 src = obj->pages->sgl;
81 dst = st->sgl;
82 for (i = 0; i < obj->pages->nents; i++) {
83 sg_set_page(dst, sg_page(src), src->length, 0);
84 dst = sg_next(dst);
85 src = sg_next(src);
86 }
87
88 if (!dma_map_sg(attachment->dev, st->sgl, st->nents, dir)) {
89 ret =-ENOMEM;
90 goto err_free_sg;
91 }
92#endif
93
94 mutex_unlock(&obj->base.dev->struct_mutex);
95 return st;
96
97#ifndef __NetBSD__
98err_free_sg:
99 sg_free_table(st);
100err_free:
101 kfree(st);
102#endif
103err_unpin:
104 i915_gem_object_unpin_pages(obj);
105err_unlock:
106 mutex_unlock(&obj->base.dev->struct_mutex);
107err:
108 return ERR_PTR(ret);
109}
110
111static void i915_gem_unmap_dma_buf(struct dma_buf_attachment *attachment,
112 struct sg_table *sg,
113 enum dma_data_direction dir)
114{
115 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj = dma_buf_to_obj(attachment->dmabuf);
116
117 mutex_lock(&obj->base.dev->struct_mutex);
118
119#ifdef __NetBSD__
120 drm_prime_sg_free(sg);
121#else
122 dma_unmap_sg(attachment->dev, sg->sgl, sg->nents, dir);
123 sg_free_table(sg);
124 kfree(sg);
125#endif
126
127 i915_gem_object_unpin_pages(obj);
128
129 mutex_unlock(&obj->base.dev->struct_mutex);
130}
131
132static void *i915_gem_dmabuf_vmap(struct dma_buf *dma_buf)
133{
134 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj = dma_buf_to_obj(dma_buf);
135 struct drm_device *dev = obj->base.dev;
136#ifdef __NetBSD__
137 struct vm_page *pg;
138#else
139 struct sg_page_iter sg_iter;
140#endif
141 struct page **pages;
142 int ret, i;
143
144 ret = i915_mutex_lock_interruptible(dev);
145 if (ret)
146 return ERR_PTR(ret);
147
148 if (obj->dma_buf_vmapping) {
149 obj->vmapping_count++;
150 goto out_unlock;
151 }
152
153 ret = i915_gem_object_get_pages(obj);
154 if (ret)
155 goto err;
156
157 i915_gem_object_pin_pages(obj);
158
159 ret = -ENOMEM;
160
161 pages = drm_malloc_ab(obj->base.size >> PAGE_SHIFT, sizeof(*pages));
162 if (pages == NULL)
163 goto err_unpin;
164
165 i = 0;
166#ifdef __NetBSD__
167 TAILQ_FOREACH(pg, &obj->pageq, pageq.queue)
168 pages[i++] = container_of(pg, struct page, p_vmp);
169 KASSERT(i == obj->base.size >> PAGE_SHIFT);
170#else
171 for_each_sg_page(obj->pages->sgl, &sg_iter, obj->pages->nents, 0)
172 pages[i++] = sg_page_iter_page(&sg_iter);
173#endif
174
175 obj->dma_buf_vmapping = vmap(pages, i, 0, PAGE_KERNEL);
176 drm_free_large(pages);
177
178 if (!obj->dma_buf_vmapping)
179 goto err_unpin;
180
181 obj->vmapping_count = 1;
182out_unlock:
183 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
184 return obj->dma_buf_vmapping;
185
186err_unpin:
187 i915_gem_object_unpin_pages(obj);
188err:
189 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
190 return ERR_PTR(ret);
191}
192
193static void i915_gem_dmabuf_vunmap(struct dma_buf *dma_buf, void *vaddr)
194{
195 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj = dma_buf_to_obj(dma_buf);
196 struct drm_device *dev = obj->base.dev;
197
198 mutex_lock(&dev->struct_mutex);
199 if (--obj->vmapping_count == 0) {
200#ifdef __NetBSD__
201 vunmap(obj->dma_buf_vmapping, obj->base.size >> PAGE_SHIFT);
202#else
203 vunmap(obj->dma_buf_vmapping);
204#endif
205 obj->dma_buf_vmapping = NULL;
206
207 i915_gem_object_unpin_pages(obj);
208 }
209 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
210}
211
212static void *i915_gem_dmabuf_kmap_atomic(struct dma_buf *dma_buf, unsigned long page_num)
213{
214 return NULL;
215}
216
217static void i915_gem_dmabuf_kunmap_atomic(struct dma_buf *dma_buf, unsigned long page_num, void *addr)
218{
219
220}
221static void *i915_gem_dmabuf_kmap(struct dma_buf *dma_buf, unsigned long page_num)
222{
223 return NULL;
224}
225
226static void i915_gem_dmabuf_kunmap(struct dma_buf *dma_buf, unsigned long page_num, void *addr)
227{
228
229}
230
231#ifdef __NetBSD__
232static int
233i915_gem_dmabuf_mmap(struct dma_buf *dma_buf, off_t *offp, size_t size,
234 int prot, int *flagsp, int *advicep, struct uvm_object **uobjp,
235 int *maxprotp)
236#else
237static int i915_gem_dmabuf_mmap(struct dma_buf *dma_buf, struct vm_area_struct *vma)
238#endif
239{
240 return -EINVAL;
241}
242
243static int i915_gem_begin_cpu_access(struct dma_buf *dma_buf, size_t start, size_t length, enum dma_data_direction direction)
244{
245 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj = dma_buf_to_obj(dma_buf);
246 struct drm_device *dev = obj->base.dev;
247 int ret;
248 bool write = (direction == DMA_BIDIRECTIONAL || direction == DMA_TO_DEVICE);
249
250 ret = i915_mutex_lock_interruptible(dev);
251 if (ret)
252 return ret;
253
254 ret = i915_gem_object_set_to_cpu_domain(obj, write);
255 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
256 return ret;
257}
258
259static const struct dma_buf_ops i915_dmabuf_ops = {
260 .map_dma_buf = i915_gem_map_dma_buf,
261 .unmap_dma_buf = i915_gem_unmap_dma_buf,
262 .release = drm_gem_dmabuf_release,
263 .kmap = i915_gem_dmabuf_kmap,
264 .kmap_atomic = i915_gem_dmabuf_kmap_atomic,
265 .kunmap = i915_gem_dmabuf_kunmap,
266 .kunmap_atomic = i915_gem_dmabuf_kunmap_atomic,
267 .mmap = i915_gem_dmabuf_mmap,
268 .vmap = i915_gem_dmabuf_vmap,
269 .vunmap = i915_gem_dmabuf_vunmap,
270 .begin_cpu_access = i915_gem_begin_cpu_access,
271};
272
273struct dma_buf *i915_gem_prime_export(struct drm_device *dev,
274 struct drm_gem_object *gem_obj, int flags)
275{
276 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj = to_intel_bo(gem_obj);
277 DEFINE_DMA_BUF_EXPORT_INFO(exp_info);
278
279 exp_info.ops = &i915_dmabuf_ops;
280 exp_info.size = gem_obj->size;
281 exp_info.flags = flags;
282 exp_info.priv = gem_obj;
283
284
285 if (obj->ops->dmabuf_export) {
286 int ret = obj->ops->dmabuf_export(obj);
287 if (ret)
288 return ERR_PTR(ret);
289 }
290
291 return dma_buf_export(&exp_info);
292}
293
294static int i915_gem_object_get_pages_dmabuf(struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj)
295{
296 struct sg_table *sg;
297#ifdef __NetBSD__
298 struct drm_device *dev = obj->base.dev;
299 bus_dmamap_t map;
300 int ret;
301#endif
302
303 sg = dma_buf_map_attachment(obj->base.import_attach, DMA_BIDIRECTIONAL);
304 if (IS_ERR(sg))
305 return PTR_ERR(sg);
306
307#ifdef __NetBSD__
308 ret = -bus_dmamap_create(dev->dmat, obj->base.size,
309 obj->base.size >> PAGE_SHIFT, obj->base.size, 0, BUS_DMA_NOWAIT,
310 &map);
311 if (ret) {
312fail0: dma_buf_unmap_attachment(obj->base.import_attach, sg,
313 DMA_BIDIRECTIONAL);
314 return ret;
315 }
316 ret = drm_prime_bus_dmamap_load_sgt(dev->dmat, map, sg);
317 if (ret) {
318fail1: __unused
319 bus_dmamap_destroy(dev->dmat, map);
320 goto fail0;
321 }
322 obj->pages = map;
323 obj->sg = sg;
324#else
325 obj->pages = sg;
326#endif
327 return 0;
328}
329
330static void i915_gem_object_put_pages_dmabuf(struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj)
331{
332#ifdef __NetBSD__
333 bus_dmamap_unload(obj->base.dev->dmat, obj->pages);
334 bus_dmamap_destroy(obj->base.dev->dmat, obj->pages);
335 obj->pages = NULL;
336 dma_buf_unmap_attachment(obj->base.import_attach,
337 obj->sg, DMA_BIDIRECTIONAL);
338 obj->sg = NULL; /* paranoia */
339#else
340 dma_buf_unmap_attachment(obj->base.import_attach,
341 obj->pages, DMA_BIDIRECTIONAL);
342#endif
343}
344
345static const struct drm_i915_gem_object_ops i915_gem_object_dmabuf_ops = {
346 .get_pages = i915_gem_object_get_pages_dmabuf,
347 .put_pages = i915_gem_object_put_pages_dmabuf,
348};
349
350struct drm_gem_object *i915_gem_prime_import(struct drm_device *dev,
351 struct dma_buf *dma_buf)
352{
353 struct dma_buf_attachment *attach;
354 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj;
355 int ret;
356
357 /* is this one of own objects? */
358 if (dma_buf->ops == &i915_dmabuf_ops) {
359 obj = dma_buf_to_obj(dma_buf);
360 /* is it from our device? */
361 if (obj->base.dev == dev) {
362 /*
363 * Importing dmabuf exported from out own gem increases
364 * refcount on gem itself instead of f_count of dmabuf.
365 */
366 drm_gem_object_reference(&obj->base);
367 return &obj->base;
368 }
369 }
370
371 /* need to attach */
372 attach = dma_buf_attach(dma_buf, dev->dev);
373 if (IS_ERR(attach))
374 return ERR_CAST(attach);
375
376 get_dma_buf(dma_buf);
377
378 obj = i915_gem_object_alloc(dev);
379 if (obj == NULL) {
380 ret = -ENOMEM;
381 goto fail_detach;
382 }
383
384 drm_gem_private_object_init(dev, &obj->base, dma_buf->size);
385 i915_gem_object_init(obj, &i915_gem_object_dmabuf_ops);
386 obj->base.import_attach = attach;
387
388 return &obj->base;
389
390fail_detach:
391 dma_buf_detach(dma_buf, attach);
392 dma_buf_put(dma_buf);
393
394 return ERR_PTR(ret);
395}
